intro: Sterculia monticola, commonly known as the mountain sterculia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
